intro: Convolvulus cinerascens, commonly known as the ash-gray convolvulus, is a flowering plant belonging to the bindweed family (Convolvulaceae). It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant characterized by its trailing or climbing growth habit. The plant produces small, funnel-shaped flowers that are typically pale yellow to brownish in color. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and covered with fine, grayish hairs. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds.
